paragraphs.title: Top 10 Most Revenue Generating Products
paragraphs.text:
%sql

select p.product_name as `Product Name`, r.display_revenue as `Total Revenue Generated`
from products p inner join
(select oi.order_item_product_id, cast(round(sum(oi.order_item_subtotal)) as Int) as revenue, format_number(round(sum(oi.order_item_subtotal)), 0) as display_revenue
from order_items oi inner join orders o
on oi.order_item_order_id = o.order_id
where o.order_status <> 'CANCELED'
and o.order_status <> 'SUSPECTED_FRAUD'
group by order_item_product_id) r
on p.product_id = r.order_item_product_id
order by r.revenue desc
limit 10

paragraphs.title: Top 10 Most Viewed Products
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select url as `Product Page URL`, product as `Product`, format_number(count(*),0)  as `Total Page Views` 
from (select url,
regexp_replace(substring_index(substring(url, instr(url, '/category/') + 10), '/product/',1),'%20', ' ') as category,
regexp_replace(substring(url, instr(url, '/product/') + 9), '%20', ' ') as product
from web_logs
where url like '%\/product\/%') s
group by url, category, product
order by count(*) desc
limit 10

paragraphs.title: Interactive Chart: Orders By Month Range And Year
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select to_date(o.order_date) as `Order Date`, count(o.*) as `Total Orders` 
from orders o 
where month(o.order_date) between ${A==1,1(Jan)|2(Feb)|3(Mar)|4(Apr)|5(May)|6(Jun)|7(Jul)|8(Aug)|9(Sep)|10(Oct)|11(Nov)|12(Dec)} and ${B==2,1(Jan)|2(Feb)|3(Mar)|4(Apr)|5(May)|6(Jun)|7(Jul)|8(Aug)|9(Sep)|10(Oct)|11(Nov)|12(Dec)} 
and year(o.order_date) = ${Year=2014,2013|2014} 
group by to_date(o.order_date) 
order by to_date(o.order_date)

paragraphs.title: Top 5 Products With Total Transactions Per Order Status
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select * from (select product_name as `Product Name`, 'Complete' as `Order Status`, count(*) as `Total Transactions`
from order_items oi 
join products p on (order_item_product_id = product_id)
join orders o on (order_item_order_id = order_id)
where order_status = 'COMPLETE'
group by order_status, product_name
order by `Total Transactions` desc limit 5)
union
select * from (select product_name as name, 'Suspected Fraud' as status, count(*) as `Total Transactions`
from order_items oi 
join products p on (order_item_product_id = product_id)
join orders o on (order_item_order_id = order_id)
where order_status = 'SUSPECTED_FRAUD'
group by order_status, product_name
order by `Total Transactions` desc limit 5)
union
select * from (select product_name as name, 'Pending Payment' as status, count(*) as `Total Transactions`
from order_items oi 
join products p on (order_item_product_id = product_id)
join orders o on (order_item_order_id = order_id)
where order_status = 'PENDING_PAYMENT'
group by order_status, product_name
order by `Total Transactions` desc limit 5)
union
select * from (select product_name as name, 'Canceled' as status, count(*) as `Total Transactions`
from order_items oi 
join products p on (order_item_product_id = product_id)
join orders o on (order_item_order_id = order_id)
where order_status = 'CANCELED'
group by order_status, product_name
order by `Total Transactions` desc limit 5)
order by `Product Name`,`Order Status`

paragraphs.title: Correlate Data: Top 10 Most Product Views vs. Revenue
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT product AS `Product`, substring(product,0,15) AS `Product Name`, count(*)/1000 AS `Total Page Views (in Thousands)`, round(COALESCE(r.revenue, 0)/1000000,2) AS `Total Revenue (in Millions)`
FROM (SELECT url,
   regexp_replace(substring_index(substring(url, instr(url, '/category/') + 10), '/product/',1),'%20', ' ') AS category,
   regexp_replace(substring(url, instr(url, '/product/') + 9), '%20', ' ') AS product
FROM web_logs
WHERE url like '%\/product\/%') s
LEFT JOIN
    (SELECT p.product_name, cast(round(sum(oi.order_item_subtotal)) AS Int) AS revenue
     FROM order_items oi
     JOIN orders o ON oi.order_item_order_id = o.order_id
     JOIN products p ON p.product_id = oi.order_item_product_id
     WHERE o.order_status <> 'CANCELED'
     AND o.order_status <> 'SUSPECTED_FRAUD'
     GROUP BY p.product_name) r ON r.product_name = product
GROUP BY product, r.revenue
ORDER BY 'Total Revenue (in Millions)', `Total Page Views (in Thousands)` DESC
LIMIT 10

paragraphs.title: Advanced Analytics: Products Frequently Purchased Together

result.msg:
orderItemsByPName: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [order_item_order_id: int, products: array<string>]

import org.apache.spark.mllib.fpm.FPGrowth

import scala.collection.mutable._

defined class ProductCombinations

orders: org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD[Array[String]] = MapPartitionsRDD[775] at map at <console>:45

model: org.apache.spark.mllib.fpm.FPGrowthModel[String] = org.apache.spark.mllib.fpm.FPGrowthModel@771d4be2

PCList: List[ProductCombinations] = List()
